::: {#main-content .container role="main"}
::: {#glossary .section}
[11.10. ]{.section-number}Glossary[¬∂](#glossary "Permalink to this heading"){.headerlink}
=========================================================================================

dictionary[¬∂](#term-dictionary "Permalink to this term"){.headerlink}

:   A collection of key-value pairs that maps from keys to values. The
    keys can be any immutable type, and the values can be any type.

key[¬∂](#term-key "Permalink to this term"){.headerlink}

:   A data item that is *mapped to* a value in a dictionary. Keys are
    used to look up values in a dictionary.

value[¬∂](#term-value "Permalink to this term"){.headerlink}

:   The value that is associated with each key in a dictionary.

key-value pair[¬∂](#term-key-value-pair "Permalink to this term"){.headerlink}

:   One of the pairs of items in a dictionary. Values are looked up in a
    dictionary by key.

mapping type[¬∂](#term-mapping-type "Permalink to this term"){.headerlink}

:   A mapping type is a data type comprised of a collection of keys and
    associated values. Python's only built-in mapping type is the
    dictionary. Dictionaries implement the [associative
    array](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Associative_array){.reference
    .external} abstract data type.
:::
